OwnableInvalidOwner(address).details: The owner is not a valid owner account. (eg. `address(0)`)

OwnableUnauthorizedAccount(address).details: The caller account is not authorized to perform an operation.

params.addr: The address of the reverse record.
params.name: The name of the reverse record.

params.coinType_: The cointype converted from the chainId of the chain this contract is deployed to.
params.owner_: The initial owner of the contract.
params.parentNode_: The parent node to set. The convention is '${coinType}.reverse'.

params.addr: The address to get the name for.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params.addr: The address to set the name for.
params.name: The name to set.

params.addr: The address to set the name for.
params.coinTypes: The coin types to set. Must be inclusive of the coin type for the contract.
params.name: The name to set.

params.coinTypes: The coin types to set. Must be inclusive of the coin type for the contract.
params.contractAddr: The address of the contract to set the name for (implementing Ownable).
params.name: The name to set.
params.owner: The owner of the contract (via Ownable).
params.signature: The signature of an address that will return true on isValidSignature for the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

CoinTypeNotFound().notice: Thrown when the coin type is not found in the provided array

NotOwnerOfContract().notice: Thrown when the specified address is not the owner of the contract

SignatureExpiryTooHigh().notice: The signature expiry is too high

Unauthorised().notice: The caller is not authorised to perform the action

NameForAddrChanged(address,string).notice: Emitted when the name for an address is changed.

batchSetName(address[]).notice: Migrates the names from the old reverse resolver to the new one.         Only callable by the owner.

coinType().notice: The coin type for the chain this contract is deployed to.

constructor.notice: Initialises the contract by setting the parent node, coin type, and old reverse resolver.

nameForAddr(address).notice: Returns the name for an address.

setName(string).notice: Sets the `nameForAddr()` record for the calling account.

setNameForAddr(address,string).notice: Sets the `nameForAddr()` record for the addr provided account.

setNameForAddrWithSignature(address,uint.notice: Sets the `nameForAddr()` record for the addr provided account using a signature.

setNameForOwnableWithSignature(address,a.notice: Sets the `nameForAddr()` record for the contract provided that is owned with `Ownable`.

userdoc.notice: An L2 Reverse Registrar that allows migrating from a prior resolver.
